column4: I just updated  my system (ubuntu 8.04) to the latest available packages yesterday. Initially when i start the computer , the keyboard works properly, after some time it stops working completely and at times starts again. Is this some kind system problem ?? or my computer has been infected by some malicious program,virus,etc ?
have you rebooted since you upgraded?
joaopinto: i know there are no viruses but the KBD stops working at times
did you reboot?
joaopinto: yes , i have rebooted several times
try to see if there is another upgrade still available (i.e. something did not upgrade yesterday that should have)
i just checked before 10 mins
and everything is updated..
put the keyboard in a different slot
have only one slot, but i checked the keyboard in centOS and it works well on it....currently i am on ubuntu 8.04
and you have checked it on centos since this problem started?
yes, everything is well on centOS
looks like hal is having a problem and other than use a different port I don't have an answer for you
:: hal is having a problem ???
the hardware abstraction layer
ok
however what you describe is typical of some hardware problem with a keyboard or the machine itself
is there a possibility of my keystrokes being sent to some one else ?
is it wireless?
no
then no
ok...thanks
